page.title: 09AGRICULTURE IN THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: Farming is the only industry of any size operating in the block & this takes place in every square. It is mainly constituted of mixed Grassland & Arable Farms, only 2 holdings being entirely grass & none entirely arable. Of 12 complete holdings with houses & buildings, 9 are situated outside the village, all of these are owner occupied. Three farms are situated in or adjoining the village, one of these is owner occupied & 2 are rented, but both of the farmers who rent holdings also own & farm other land in the block. Eleven of the 12 farms are in excess of 130 acres. Most of the farms are run as family units using mainly family labour, only 2 of the farms employ a regular agricultural worker although limited casual workers in the form of contractors & seasonal labour are employed.
